meanings.definition: Remove mist or condensation from (a surface)
meanings.sent1: After the rain, I defogged the car windows so I could see clearly.
meanings.sent2: She defogged her glasses with a cloth to see better.
meanings.sent3: I defogged the bathroom mirror after my hot shower, so I could see my funny face.
meanings.sent4: The defogged windshield revealed a clear view of the road ahead.
meanings.sent5: With a quick wipe, he defogged the bathroom mirror, revealing his reflection.

meanings.definition: Make (something) clear or easy to understand
meanings.sent1: The teacher defogged the complicated math problem for the students.
meanings.sent2: She defogged the instructions, making them simple to follow.
meanings.sent3: He defogged the confusing map, turning it into a clear guide.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation defogged the concept, making it easy to grasp.
meanings.sent5: The tutorial video defogged the process, making it straightforward to replicate.
